Creative writing - "capturing emotion" poetry assignment hot pencil thingy My mind's a mess. I don't want to worry about homework or taking out the trash or anything else right now. I don't want people talking to me, either. I just want to see if my best friend is home, and then I want to fall asleep listening to some Bjork. That would be nice. Her amazing voice always manages to soothe me, sometimes even when I'm feeling like this. What would soothe me even more is to hear the sound of my best friend chattering away to me about the crazy events of her day, because, the truth is, my obsesion with her - my Lauren - far outweighs my obsession with Bjork. (That's pretty big.) I speedily punch in her number, knowing that the chances of her picking up are slim, especially since she'll want to get online soon - it's almost 8:30. (She has dial-up connection.) In spite of knowing this, my heart grows heavy when I hear the answering machine pick up. I try a few more times, but with no luck - it rang more than three times on the third try, which means that someone is using the Internet. Tears begin to well up in my eyes. There was a time when she'd call me everyday if something like this should happen. No, I can't be thinking like this. She grows irritated with me when I do, and really, who can blame her? But now that the tears have started to fall, I can't stop them, and not even Bjork can cheer me up. I remove my glasses and my clothing, slip into a fresh pair of boxers and a tank top, curl up in a fetal position with my comforter pulled high over my body upon my bed - a lame attempt at consoling myself. Suddenly, I remember a sticker I received from some stupid assembly thing earlier today at school. I take my shirt that I had been wearing, peel the sticker off and slap it on the wall, for no apparent reason except to mark the moment in some tangible form. It's been there ever since. Now, boxes fill up my room and my mom's happy chatter about the new place we're to move to follows me everywhere. I know I should remove thes ticker fromt he wall, but lingering sentiments always manage to sneak their way in and prevent me from doing so. The truth is, I'd like to keep it there forever, but who wants to stare at a stupid "Elect Howard Dean" promotion sticker? How could I describe its significance to somebody without sounding like a complete loon - and really, when would I get the chance to? Should I leave it there, the future owner of my bedroom will see it, pry it off, can it and never think twice about it. Such is the meaning of my emotions - valid and important to me at a moment, disposable at another. Such is the poetry of my life: feel, materialize, reminisce and destroy. It seems the only one who remembers is myself. Don't mock its suckiness. We have to do a poetry unit, and over the past year, I've grown to despise poetry. Bleh. Only another semester, and then I'm out of here. My writing has been taking a major downfall this year. Fucking hell. I was eating food and this greasy whore comes over and sits with me and...I don't really know why. She was sitting at a table across from me and then spontaneously decided to come over and...sit with me. I had to...smell her. And I don't know what she was trying to do by this - in her pork-fried brain she probably thought this made her cool - but she pulled out a Barbie-pink Gameboy, all the while glancing up at me while putting in games. I was trying not to say something bitchy or mean to her, but god fucking damn it - I don't know you, I don't want to know you, get the fuck away from me before you drip fucking grease out of your hair and into my food and I have to go crazy and mutilate you and then get myself arrested for something that wasn't even worth it and only temporarily made me feel better. o_o Bleh. She made this pitiful expression when, after scoffing down my food as fast as I could so I could get out of there faster, I got up to throw my garbage away and proceeded to leave the lunch room...the creepy fuck's gaze never left me. Stupid smelly skank, BE GONE DON'T YOU LOVE HOW NICE I AM? And I wonder why I have no friends :P But seriously...I don't want to see - or smell - that shit when I'm eating my food. She looked like a sped, anyway, so maybe she just didn't know any better. Meh. I'm done bitching now.

I feel so...nimble. It almost makes me want to hole up in my room without emerging for a month playing video games nonstop just so I can be weak and docile again. =P At swim practice yesterday, I was clocked again, and now I'm at 49 seconds - one of the fastest on my team, and now there's a far more noticeable difference in my back and arm muscles - my leg ones, too; if I'm tensing up my calves, they feel like rocks, and when I don't, they're still pretty firm to the touch. This is so weird. This is like...the first time ever I've ever been in any kind of peak physical shape. :P I'm pretty proud of myself.

We have to do this dialogue thingy for creative writing, so I decided that my hapless resource room teacher is to be my muse for the rest of the year, so my dialogue is between her and a block of Canadian swiss cheese. Whee. The best part is that I'm getting an A in that class, and all of my essays have been equally pointless. It's the best. Hooray for stupidity earning good grades! Women's Literature is and always will suck and will never be a good kind of stupid, though. Bah. Stupid uber-feminists.

Stupid bell, all ringing and shit. Now I must end this.

BUSH NEEDS TO DIE.

AWKLGHASKJGHASJKGHLAWEKGHAJGDSA.

Stupid fucking bastard.

Oh yeah! I can't believe I left this out. I found out today that I have a cult following of fans. So I already said in an earlier entry once how I like to draw random shit on the chalk board, because the teacher doesn't mind (and actually likes them sometimes)...but today since we had an assembly it was mod B first, but I didn't realize that, so I came in and started drawing and these kids were like "So YOU'RE the one who does those drawings on the board!" and they were all laughing over them. Now why can't that be my class? Nobody laughs at them in my class :P Oh well. That is all.

I beat Final Fantasy X last night. What an amazing game. I cried at the end, not just because it was sad but just...the whole damn game was perfect. The storyline was great, the characters were engaging, the graphics were amazing and the whole thing was just...whee. And they actually made Tidus and Yuna romantically involved in an un-annoying way. (That's almost impossible to do in anything.) And yes, I realize that by making these statements, I have forever sealed my fate of dorkdom, but I don't care. I want the Japanese version of FFX, just so I can hear what the characters sound like in another language :P That's going on my Christmas wishlist, yep.

Oh yeah, historical event - I get muscles. I've been flexing my arms and back muscles all weekend to my mom and driving her crazy. "MOM! LOOK WHAT SWIMMING'S DONE! I'M ACTUALLY *gasp* PHYSICALLY FIT!" Whoohoo. It's kind of hard, and I probably won't make it to our first swim meet, but it's fun, and it gets easier with each practice. Meets start December 7th...hopefully I'll be a faster swimmer by then...right now I can do a freehand at 100 yards at 59 seconds, but I guess that's ok because two other people got around that, too, and the fastest was at 54. Blah. I'm glad I did this. I look so...athletic in my swim gear. I should be getting prescription goggles within a week or so, too.

I miss Bobish. Jen smells good. The end.

Once upon a time, there lived a goat. A giant, angry blueberry flew down from the skies, marched up to the goat and swallowed it whole. Then, a tapdancing kiwi went up to the blueberry, kicked it in the shin, and proceeded to feed its offspring with it. The kiwis grew very strong and very large, and as soon as they reached dinosaur size, they marched into Albania and destroyed everything. They thought they had conquered the world, until bin Laden came down, plopped down upon them and ate his cherry pie. "Oi! This pie be damn good!" exclaimed the infamous terrorist and retired gay porn star. He felt something squishy beneath him, so he reached down to pick his rump when angry bits of disparaged kiwis blew him to pieces. Then the world fell apart, except for Albania, which floated in outer space, until an angry mob of Hungarian wilderbeasts flew up to it and..uh...ate it.

The moral of this story is that Jen is hot. The end.

The first day was nice, disregarding the fact that I was stuck behind this really slow guy who couldn't even do the fucking crawl stroke correctly, and he'd stop in the middle of the fucking pool to say hi to his friends in a different lane. o_o I wanted to lodge flippers up his ass at painful angles. Yep. I think something must've happened between him and the coach because he didn't show up yesterday. It completely overrules my Tomb Raider fandom. I used a friend sphere to move Yuna over to Lulu's magical sphere thingy, so I taught her a bunch of Lulu's spells so now she's a double mage. I bet my Yuna could kick your Yuna's ass. Yep. This game is ridiculously easy, though. The only parts (so far) that really challenged me were the third cloister of trials and the stupid "wyrm" thingy. They could've made Seymour at least mildly difficult to kill...though I hear he's harder the last two times around, which I haven't gotten to...maybe it's just me, though, because Matt's been playing it for a while and he found it really difficult. I'll stop babbling about my dumb video game now. For those who have no idea what I'm talking about, just uh...pretend you're enlightened. Stupid dead computer. Maybe I should cram flippers at painful angles up it's smelly little mechanical rump.

Some woman wants me to sketch her wedding portrait. I don't really want to, but she's paying me to do it, and she's offering to pay for any supplies I need to do it so of course I'm doing it. (Heh, I need a job.) The only problem is, I don't know or remember the names of anything, so basically my list of needed supplies looks like this: Wedding picture (:P) HB art pencil thingies Smudgy tooly papery thingy Big easel-y (but not easel-y...I have no fucking idea what it's called and I don't know how to describe it) sketchy thingy Squishy-bendy eraser thingy Honey eraser (the only thing I remember :P) So uhh..yeah. She should have fun with that list *cough*. I'm so god damn bored during the week now. o_o All I do is sit at home watching the Science Channel all day and drawing random objects in the household. (I drew the cover of my Ever After tape the other day which I WOULD scan if I had a fucking computer to scan it onto.) Thanks to my boredom, I now know how radio waves in the '70s unearthed energy waves in outer space which is proof of the big bang theory or something similar to it, how an AIDS vaccination is underway and should be expected within the next ten years (and why some women are immune to it), how and why the box jellyfish is one of the most deadly sea creatures in the world, the birth of astronomy and how it goes hand-in-hand with astrology, and other fun things. YAY SCIENCE o.o Actually, because I'm a dork, I find it interesting, I just feel really stupid sitting there all day watching the fucking Science Channel. I could be doing something *gasp* productive, afterall. (Because, you know, wasting the afternoon on neopets.com is SO much more enlightening and enthralling than the amazing cycle of polar bear hibernation.) Uhh..I actually DID do stuff on Tuesday, because we had the day off. I went up to Aly's house. Aly's pretty boring though. Her brother's better. :P He's more amusing. We watched "Finding Nemo" (which was a pretty good movie, but I liked "Ice Age" better) and he...uh...sat on me. (And he weighs 200+ lbs.) That was interesting. I almost lost feeling in my legs, but that's A-OK! Later on we had girl-slap competitions. He's a better girl-slapper than I am. That makes me sad. :( My mom's being a whore about the computer. She keeps talking about getting it fixed but I'm pretty positive it was the fan breaking down that caused the computer to overheat (because what else could explain why the computer was so hot when I touched it, why it smelled afterwards, and why for a while before it died it made this weird grinding noise?), and if I'm right, then the computer isn't salvageable, and WE NEED A FUCKING NEW ONE. But no, stupid whore's always right. Blah. Anyway, the mod is about to end, and I'm stupid, so the end.

Blah. My computer died last night. Just like...flat out died. The room smelled weird for a while. My computer made this weird grinding noise, and then it just like... Died. Croaked. Bit the dust. Finally! Now my mom will buy us a new one. But...I don't know when that'll be. -_- So yeah. I'm typing this up in the Resource Room right now. Figures that the one day I actually need this thing to make an important message, everyone and their cousin has to use the fucking Internet today. Grr. Not cool. I don't know how this will affect my updating, but it's not like I ever really have anything interesting to say, anyway. Bobish, can you please call me when you get the chance? :/ I'm out of calling card minutes.

This idiot in my summer school class thinks that by eliminating drug use, he's living a healthier life. Alas, he pays no attention to what he eats, he smokes like a chimney everytime I see him outside of school and, to my knowledge, he once said that he continuously gets drunk on weekends. BUT, he doesn't do drugs. When I brought this to his attention, his response was this: "But I'm FAR healthier now!" I actually think that cigarettes alone are worse than abusing drugs. They do their damage more slowly. They take years and years and years to weave their destruction and by the time you finally make the move to quit (or not), it's too late. Smoking-related deaths are by far some of the most slow, gruesome and torturous deaths, in my opinion. Few are able to evade such consequences, but the vast majority of smokers don't. Beh. And now I sound like your typical straight-edge fanatic, people who I have little patience for. But I will continue with my argument anyway, should I be put to shame by it or not. It's what I feel, and I've been meaning to make an entry about this for a while now. I hear a lot of drug users and/or abusers complain about the majority of "straight-edgers", but I find it a little unfair how they dismiss us all as "squares" or "raised by government propaganda". True, many people are too crazy about it. I admit that. I also admit that a lot of America's "war against drugs" is pretty flawed and one-sided. A lot of anti-drug folks take their message a little too far. However, I as someone who won't even touch a caffeinated beverage feel a little cheated and angered when someone tells me that because I won't pick up a drink or smoke a bong means I "don't know how to have fun" and/or acts as if I'm trying to be some sort of a parental figure to them. I'm not. I have friends who smoke weed, even a few that occasionally do a line or shoot up. Do I hold it against them? Do I try and shove it down their throats the drugs-are-bad, you're-going-to-become-addicts and you're-fucking-up-your-lives bullshit? No. The few that I do happen to know know the meaning of the words "moderation" and "control" - something most drug users don't, and no one, not even drug users themselves, can deny that - and are actually quite intelligent. It all just comes off to me like whiny rebellious preteens all hot and bitter because heaven forbid they don't always get their way, especially in dangerous situations. So what are they going to do to prove their so-called points? Destroy their bodies and their lives? Ok, I know that came off as biased, and I'm also aware that it kind of contradicts what I was saying before. But what I mean is this: most of the drug users I have met are actually not drug users but drug abusers. (Yes, to all the fanatical "sXe kids" reading this right now, there is a difference.) They do them because their friends think it's cool and their mommies tell them no. Sometimes I think they should shut up and listen to those horrible horrible straight-edge kids they all seem to feel so inclined to bash. Maybe they might actually *gasp* LEARN something. (Although I think that may be too much for a few burnt-out braincells to handle.) And by no way am I speaking of all the drug users in the world in these statements, but of all the drug users whom I myself have come across through my own experiences. That is my drug rant. And now for my anti-drug rant, to explain why I'm also against the ever-overzealous straight-edge kid. Ok. It's great that you're a vegan in tip-top shape with high morals and a sense of right and wrong. It's great that you feel you have a direction and purpose in life. That's all fine, dandy and respectable. But did you ever stop and think that maybe the honor roll student sitting next to you occasionally does a line? Because someone uses drugs does not mean that they ABUSE them, nor does it make them the typical slack-jawed, runny-nosed, emaciated bag of bones you were taught to believe that all drug users are. Some of the most open-minded and intellectual people you will ever have the chance to meet, in my opinion and in the opinion of many others, are, or were, drug users. That's not to say that if you go out and smoke crack and snort a few lines you'll be exalted to a higher plane of existence and ultimate enlightenment. If you believe that, then you're just stupid. Mostly it'll just give your brain a nice fry. However, to dismiss something outside of your morals and values without reading between the lines is even stupider than using drugs with such expectations, and makes you just as stupid as the strung-out dope fiend blind to the truth around him/her. Point blank, what I'm trying to say is that if you place yourself above the man standing next to you morally simply because he's smoking a cigarette/cigar or a bong and you're not, YOU'RE AN IDIOT. First of all, you're inhaling his second-hand carcinogens which is scientifically proven to be more dangerous than the smoke itself, so you're just as fucked as he is, and secondly, a bum on a street could have never touched a bottle of whisky or a pack of Marlbro's in his lifetime while Mr. High-life walks down the street and throws said bum a coin while puffing blissfully away on his expensive Cuban cigar, so does that make the bum above Mr. High-life? To denounce a person's judgment and worth simply by his/her personal activities is pretty flawed, and no doubt it's people like you that gives being straight-edge such a bad rep. I have more to say, but I'm sick of typing. Maybe I'll edit this entry later on, or make a "Becca's Drug Rant pt. 2" instead. Heh.
